items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $15,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of Lamar Jamal Perkins.
items.caution:
Lamar Jamal Perkins is wanted for his alleged involvement in the conspiracy to kidnap at gunpoint an individual he and others had met at the MGM Grand Hotel & Casino in National Harbor, Maryland, on February 3, 2021.  It is alleged that the victim was kidnapped at gunpoint, driven to Washington, D.C., beaten, and threatened in order to obtain information regarding the code to the safe in his hotel room.  During the abduction, the suspects allegedly stole property from the victim, including his hotel key, watch, wallet, identification, and phone.  In addition, the suspects allegedly took cash, poker chips, drugs, an Xbox, a backpack, and a suitcase from the victim’s hotel room.  The kidnappers also allegedly pointed a gun at the victim, placed a gun in the victim’s mouth, hit the victim in the face and head with a gun, and threatened to kill the victim’s family members if the victim contacted law enforcement.  The victim was safely recovered.  On March 30, 2021, a federal arrest warrant was issued for Perkins in the United States District Court, District of Maryland, Greenbelt, Maryland, after he was charged with conspiracy to commit kidnapping.

 

This investigation was conducted by the FBI Washington Field Office’s DC Safe Streets Task Force, which is composed of FBI agents, along with detectives from the Washington Metropolitan Police Department and the Prince George’s County Police Department. The Task Force works in partnership with other federal agencies, including the United States Park Police, Bureau of Alcohol Tobacco and Firearms, Drug Enforcement Administration, Homeland Security Investigations, and U.S. Marshals Service, and is charged with investigating and bringing prosecution against the most egregious violent street gangs and crews operating in the National Capital Region. Investigative assistance in this matter was provided by the FBI Baltimore Field Office.
items.title: LAMAR JAMAL PERKINS
items.remarks: Perkins' last known address was in Washington, D.C.
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED AND DANGEROUS

items.caution: Jorge Roberto Montano Pellegrini is wanted for his alleged involvement in a wire fraud scheme.  From approximately December 1, 2009, to August 5, 2014, Pellegrini allegedly defrauded a Lebanon, New Hampshire, based investment advisor, and its clients, who had entrusted Pellegrini with managing client funds intended for investment in teak plantations in Guatemala.  The total loss may exceed $11 million.  A Criminal Complaint was filed on December 29, 2014, in the United States District Court, District of New Hampshire, Concord, New Hampshire, and Pellegrini was charged with wire fraud.  He was later indicted by a federal grand jury in the United States District Court in Concord, New Hampshire, on May 3, 2021, on three counts of wire fraud.
items.title: JORGE ROBERTO MONTANO PELLEGRINI
items.remarks: Pellegrini has ties to Miami, Florida; New York; and El Salvador.  He holds both a Guatemalan Passport as well as an Italian Passport.  He most recently resided in or near Guatemala City, Guatemala.

items.weight: Approximately 40 to 42 pounds (at time of disappearance)
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information leading to the recovery of Aranza Maria Ochoa Lopez.
items.title: ARANZA MARIA OCHOA LOPEZ
items.details:
The FBI's Seattle Field Office is assisting the Vancouver Police Department in Washington with their search for Aranza Maria Ochoa Lopez.

 

On October 25, 2018, Aranza was allegedly removed from a mall in Vancouver, Washington, by her biological mother, who was taken into custody in September of 2019 in Puebla, Mexico. It is believed that Aranza may still be in Mexico.
items.remarks: Aranza was last seen wearing a long-sleeved dark blue shirt with a bulldog on the front; blue, purple, and white striped pants; and Paw Patrol shoes. Her appearance may have been altered through hair dye and makeup.

items.details: Karla Rodriguez was last seen in Las Vegas, Nevada, on October 20, 1999.  At the time of her disappearance, she spoke limited English.
items.scars_and_marks: Karla has a small mole above her right eyebrow.
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $5,000 for information that leads to the whereabouts of Karla Rodriguez.  Additional reward money may be available.
items.title: KARLA RODRIGUEZ

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of Devontay Davoucci Anderson.
items.caution:
Devontay Davoucci Anderson is wanted for his alleged involvement in the violent murder of a 7-year-old girl in Chicago, Illinois.  At approximately 4:18 p.m. on April 18, 2021, Anderson and an associate allegedly fired into a vehicle carrying the child and her father as they waited in the drive-thru of a Chicago restaurant. The child was struck several times and fatally injured. The child’s father was struck once, but survived. 

 

On April 26, 2021, Anderson was charged with first degree murder in the Circuit Court of Cook County, Illinois, and a state warrant was issued for his arrest.  A federal arrest warrant was issued for Anderson on April 29, 2021, in the United States District Court, Northern District of Illinois, Eastern Division, Chicago, Illinois, after he was charged with unlawful flight to avoid prosecution.
items.scars_and_marks: Anderson has a small tattoo of capital letters written in script over his right eyebrow.
items.title: DEVONTAY DAVOUCCI ANDERSON
items.description: Unlawful Flight to Avoid Prosecution - First Degree Murder
items.remarks: Anderson is known to have connections to Illinois, Indiana, and Florida.
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED AND DANGEROUS

items.title: ROBERT LEE HOURIHAN - PALMYRA, VIRGINIA
items.details: On April 8, 2011, Robert Lee Hourihan disappeared after visiting the E.W. Thomas Grocery store at approximately 8:00 a.m. in Palmyra, Virginia. The victim's last cell phone call was at 7:41 a.m. in Palmyra, Virginia. The victim was driving a white 2004 Chevrolet Cavalier with personalized license plates "TARAMAE." on May 28, 2011, the vehicle was located in a Target parking lot in La Plata, Maryland. For additional information regarding this victim, refer to the National Missing and Unidentified Persons System (NamUs) missing person database, case report number MP#10497.
items.remarks: The victim wore blue work pants, a light gray T-Shirt, and work boots.

items.title: JOHN DOE - DOSWELL, VIRGINIA
items.details: On February 23, 1982, a partially decomposed Hispanic male was located in Doswell, Virginia, on the side of Interstate 95. The cause of death was from multiple gunshot wounds.
items.remarks: The victim wore a white ski sweater with a gray and red horizontal band across the mid chest over a green t-shirt bearing hte legend "Someone went to Florida and all I got was a lousy T-shirt." The victim's jewelry included a gold crucifix on a chain necklace, a wedding band with the inscription 4-14-75 Lucy TJ1 18k, and a Seiko wrist watch with days of the week in Spanish.

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $5,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the person or persons responsible for the disappearance and/or death of Jamie Lynette Yazzie.
items.title: JAMIE LYNETTE YAZZIE
items.details: Jamie Lynette Yazzie was last seen on the evening of June 30, 2019, in the area of Pinon, Arizona, within the boundaries of the Navajo Nation Indian Reservation.  The FBI is requesting any possible information regarding her whereabouts or the details and circumstances surrounding her disappearance.

items.title: RYAN BRADEN CHICOVSKY
items.details:
Ryan Braden Chicovsky was teaching English in China when he travelled to Laos on vacation. He was last seen on or about March 13, 2006, leaving the Khemkong Guesthouse in Xiangkok, a remote river village in Northwestern Laos.

 

His backpack, clothes, money, passport, boots, and toiletries were all discovered in his room. Approximately three weeks after the reported disappearance, local villagers discovered Chicovsky's camera, room key, and T-shirt four kilometers north of Xiangkok. The condition of the items indicates they had been kept inside and out of the rain.
items.remarks: Chicovsky typically wore a braided rope/bead necklace.

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $5,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the person or persons responsible for setting the fire.
items.title: CHURCH ARSON
items.details:
The FBI’s Denver Field Office is seeking the public’s assistance in identifying the person(s) responsible for the Monday, April 26, 2021 arson at Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints located at 417 East Ottley Avenue, Fruita, Colorado.


The Lower Valley Fire District and Fruita Police Department in Colorado responded to a 9-1-1 call and determined that the fire was an apparent arson. No one was inside the church at the time of the fire, and there are no known injuries. The structure sustained significant damage.
items.description:
Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
Fruita, Colorado
April 26, 2021

images.caption: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints
Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints Arson

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $5,000 for information leading to the arrest of Manuel Virgen-Galvan.
items.caution:
Manuel Virgen-Galvan is wanted for his alleged involvement in a murder in 2005.

 

On June 29, 2005, Virgen-Galvan allegedly shot and killed a 14-year-old boy in Sylmar, California, while the boy was in front of the boy's residence painting a friend's bicycle.

 

Virgen-Galvan was charged with murder by the Superior Court of California, County of Los Angeles, and a state warrant was issued for his arrest on July 7, 2005. A federal arrest warrant was issued by the United States District Court, Central District of California, Los Angeles, California, on January 26, 2006, after Virgen-Galvan was charged federally with unlawful flight to avoid prosecution.
items.scars_and_marks: Virgen-Galvan is missing one of his front teeth.
items.title: MANUEL VIRGEN-GALVAN
items.description: Unlawful Flight to Avoid Prosecution - Murder
items.remarks: Virgen-Galvan may be residing in, and has ties to, Mexico.
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED, DANGEROUS, AND AN ESCAPE RISK

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $25,000 for information leading to the identification and arrest of the individual(s) responsible for the homicide of Trina'ty Riley and Kayden Johnson.
items.title: TRINA'TY RILEY AND KAYDEN JOHNSON
items.details:
The FBI’s St. Louis Field Office and the St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department are asking for the public’s assistance in locating the individual(s) responsible for the death of 18-year-old Trina'ty Riley and her 2-year-old son Kayden Johnson.

On April 30, 2019, officers with the St. Louis Metropolitan Police Department were dispatched to a shooting at a residence in St. Louis, Missouri. When police arrived on scene, they found the mother and her toddler were fatally shot inside their own home.

This case is being investigated as part of the Department of Justice's Operation Legend, a coordinated federal and local law enforcement initiative to fight violent crime.
items.description:
Homicide Victims
St. Louis, Missouri
April 30, 2019

items.details: Law enforcement authorities are seeking information in the disappearance of Robert Garrett Stewart, Jr., from Montana in October of 2013.
items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information that leads to the resolution of this case.
items.title: ROBERT GARRETT STEWART, JR.

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of those responsible for the deaths of Matthew and Philip Reagan.
items.title: MATTHEW AND PHILIP REAGAN
items.details:
The Federal Bureau of Investigation's Phoenix Field Office, Gallup Resident Agency, is seeking the public’s assistance in identifying the unknown individual(s) responsible for the murders of brothers Matthew Reagan and Philip Reagan.

 

Matthew and Philip's bodies were found on March 21, 2020, in Sawmill, Arizona, on the Navajo Nation Indian Reservation. The brothers were traveling from Ohio to California, and were passing through Sawmill at the time of their deaths. The medical examiner ruled both deaths to be a homicide.

items.caution: Efran Cornejo Yanez is wanted for allegedly shooting three men with a handgun at Giddens Mobile Home Park in Enigma, Berrien County, Georgia, on April 15, 2006.  One of the men died as a result of the shooting.  On April 16, 2006, Yanez was charged with murder in Berrien County and a state arrest warrant was issued for him.  On December 12, 2006, a federal arrest warrant was issued by the United States District Court, Middle District of Georgia, Valdosta Division, Albany, Georgia, after Yanez was charged with unlawful flight to avoid prosecution.
items.title: EFRAN CORNEJO YANEZ
items.description: Unlawful Flight to Avoid Prosecution - Felony Murder

images.caption: Photograph age progressed to 55 years old

items.remarks: Yanez has ties to Florida and Texas.
items.warning_message: SHOULD BE CONSIDERED ARMED AND DANGEROUS

items.scars_and_marks: The individual had a nose deformity described as a prior broken nose with a slight deformity to the left side of victim’s face.
items.title: JOHN DOE - YORK, PENNSYLVANIA
items.details: On Monday, November 18, 2013, the unidentified human remains of a male subject were discovered in a wooded area in West Manchester Township, York County, Pennsylvania. Post mortem interval is greater than 3 years and as much as 10 years. For additional information and photographs regarding this victim, refer to the National Missing and Unidentified Persons System (NamUs) unidentified remains database, case report number UP# 12047.
items.remarks: The victim wore a black leather jacket, size unknown; Knocker brand boxer shorts, small size, with blue and red checks; and a pair of purple Mongoose sunglasses.

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $20,000 for information leading to the identification, arrest, and conviction of the person(s) responsible for this crime.
items.suspects:
Suspect #1 is described as a White female between 5'8" and 5'10", weighing approximately 120 pounds, with dirty blonde/purple hair. Her eye color is unknown.

Suspect #2 is described as a Black person between 5'5" and 5'7", weighing approximately 120  pounds. The hair and eye color are unknown.
items.title: ARSON – POSSESSION OF A DESTRUCTIVE DEVICE
items.details: The FBI, ATF, and Seattle Police Department are investigating an arson which occurred on August 24, 2020, at 11 p.m., in the SODO region of Seattle, Washington. Two suspects were observed scouting the area around the Seattle Police Officer’s Guild building in the hour before the attack. The suspects changed into all black clothing and returned to the building, where they ignited and threw three Molotov cocktails at the structure, and then fled the area on foot.

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $50,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the person or persons responsible for the murders of Wilson Edison Black Elk, Jr. and Ronald Owen Hard Heart.
items.title: RONALD OWEN HARD HEART
items.details: On Tuesday, June 8, 1999, the bodies of Wilson Edison Black Elk, Jr. and Ronald Owen Hard Heart were found on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation(PRIR) in South Dakota, several hundred yards north of the Nebraska-South Dakota border near White Clay, Nebraska. The two victims, both residents of PRIR, were last seen on the main road to Pine Ridge, South Dakota from White Clay, Nebraska on Sunday, June 6, 1999. Authorities have determined that both victims were murdered.

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $50,000 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the person or persons responsible for the murders of Wilson Edison Black Elk, Jr. and Ronald Owen Hard Heart.
items.title: WILSON EDISON BLACK ELK, JR.
items.details: On Tuesday, June 8, 1999, the bodies of Wilson Edison Black Elk, Jr. and Ronald Owen Hard Heart were found on the Pine Ridge Indian Reservation(PRIR) in South Dakota, several hundred yards north of the Nebraska-South Dakota border near White Clay, Nebraska. The two victims, both residents of PRIR, were last seen on the main road to Pine Ridge, South Dakota from White Clay, Nebraska on Sunday, June 6, 1999. Authorities have determined that both victims were murdered.

items.reward_text: The FBI is offering a reward of up to $10,000 for information leading to the arrest and indictment of the individual(s) responsible for the disappearance and/or death of Joseph James Bruce, Sr.
items.title: JOSEPH JAMES BRUCE, SR.
items.details:
The Federal Bureau of Investigation's Minneapolis Field Office is asking for the public's assistance in identifying the person(s) responsible for the disappearance and/or death of Joseph James Bruce, Sr.

Bruce, Sr. was reported missing in Grand Forks, North Dakota, on July 3, 2018. He was last seen and heard from in the areas of Devils Lake and Fort Totten, North Dakota, on or around June 25, 2018. The van belonging to Bruce, Sr. was later located on the Spirit Lake Reservation in North Dakota.
items.remarks: Bruce, Sr. is known to frequent Devils Lake, Grand Forks, and Fort Totten, North Dakota.
